answers.answer: Hi!I am sorry to hear about your medical problems. However, don’t worry. Even if you have diabetes, there are many things you can eat. You can drink clear soups and chicken broths. Apart from that, you can eat low sugar fruits like cucumber, guava, apple (a few slices), papaya (a few bites), carrots, and other local fruits in your area. You can eat all green vegetables (sauted, stir fries, boiled, stew form etc). Sprouts, whole grains, roasted snacks, multigrain bread, etc can keep you full. Please consult a dietician and plan out a diet chart. There are many more things you can eat based on your personal taste. Take care!The medical advice given should not be considered a substitute for medical care provided by a doctor who can examine you. The advice may not be completely correct for you as the doctor cannot examine you and does not know your complete medical history. Hence this reply to your post should only be considered as a guiding line and you must consult your doctor at the earliest for your medical problem.

question: I am going on 22 weeks of my pregnancy, i have pre existing diabetes i take four shots a day, i have lowered my A1C very good, but the farther along in my pregnancy the harder its becoming. I am hungery all the time, but i also eat five bites and im full.I know eating healthier is the key word and exercise, but ive been very sick with a head cold and trying to rest.Does anyone know of healthy foods or snacks that are good to eat. Im to the point of having an emotional break down
title: pregnanct with first child and diabetes
